Nairobi Disaster

16-storey building collapses in South C, raising urgent safety concerns.

16-Storey Building Collapses in Nairobi

By Zawadi Intel Staff | Jan 2, 2026

A 16-storey building under construction in South C, Nairobi, collapsed suddenly, leaving several people trapped and one confirmed injured.

The collapse occurred in the early hours, sending shockwaves through the neighborhood as residents rushed to the scene.

Emergency responders, including firefighters and Kenya Red Cross teams, quickly mobilized to rescue those trapped under the rubble.

Witnesses reported hearing loud cracks before the structure gave way, raising questions about construction quality.

Authorities have launched an investigation into whether the building met regulatory standards and safety codes.

Survivors described narrow escapes, with some construction workers managing to flee moments before the collapse.

Local leaders have condemned the incident, calling it a tragic reminder of lax enforcement in Nairobi‚Äôs booming real estate sector.

Experts warn that rapid urbanization has led to shortcuts in construction, putting lives at risk.

Families of those trapped anxiously await updates as rescue operations continue into the night.

The government has pledged to hold developers accountable and review permits issued for high-rise projects in the city.

Community members have organized support for victims, providing food and shelter to those displaced.

International observers highlight the collapse as part of a wider challenge facing African cities balancing growth and safety.

The tragedy underscores the urgent need for reform in Kenya‚Äôs construction sector to prevent future disasters.
